intro: Brachystelma franksiae, commonly known as the Frank's dwarf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in winter. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Brachystelma franksiae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive floral display.
